mng: ordinal number, day of a month, mark, sign, business establishment, size, ship suffix, horn (wind instrument), bugle call, assumed name, to take a pulse, classifier used to indicate number of people

exm.mng: ordinal number, day of a month, mark, sign, business establishment, size, ship suffix, horn (wind instrument), bugle call, assumed name, to take a pulse, classifier used to indicate number of people
characters and numbers (as used in a code), alphanumeric code, serial number
first day of the month, toilet, (slang) giver (in a homosexual relationship)
to take one's seat according to the ticket number, (fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place, to take a general comment as a personal attack, to take a criticism for oneself
an order (esp. army), bugle call expressing military order, verbal command
